items.title: Government’s historic role as trusted information source is under threat
items.description: The U.S. government for decades has been the world’s leader provider of trusted data. Many researchers wonder if that is still the case.

items.title: Tucker Carlson inflames a raging battle for MAGA’s future
items.description: The provocative podcaster has an audience – online, among influencers and inside the White House. That worries some on the right.

items.title: Trump makes affordability pitch in struggling corner of N.C., his last rally of 2025
items.description: Trump used the rally to hammer the issue his advisers want him to emphasize as his poll numbers lag.

items.title: Lou Cannon, Post reporter and preeminent Reagan biographer, dies at 92
items.description: His books on Reagan “have never been transcended,” said presidential historian Douglas Brinkley.

items.title: U.S. strikes dozens of sites in Syria in retaliation for troops’ deaths
items.description: The expansive operation follows the killing last weekend of two U.S. soldiers and their interpreter at a military base in the city of Palmyra.
